info.name: Embloy-API Collection
info.description: # Getting Started ## Step 1: Fork the collection using Run in Postman [](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/19024122-92a85d0e-51e7-47da-9f83-c45dcb1cdf24?action=collection/fork&collection-url=entityId=19024122-92a85d0e-51e7-47da-9f83-c45dcb1cdf24&entityType=collection&workspaceId=345300e6-346e-42e0-aed1-53717919aef0#?env%5BPayPal%20Override%20Env%) [](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/19024122-92a85d0e-51e7-47da-9f83-c45dcb1cdf24?action=collection/fork&collection-url=entityId=19024122-92a85d0e-51e7-47da-9f83-c45dcb1cdf24&entityType=collection&workspaceId=345300e6-346e-42e0-aed1-53717919aef0#?env%5BPayPal%20Override%20Env%) ## Step 2: Get your access token #### If you don't have an account yet: 1. Create new user `POST:/user` 2. Verify user `GET:/user/verify` 3. Save the JWT-Token in the response of `GET:/user/verify` in the variable `refresh_token` 4. Request new access token with `POST:/user/auth/token/access` 5. Save access token to variable `Ã ccess_token` #### Else, sign in with existing account: 1. Request new refresh token via `POST:/user/auth/token/refresh` using your credentials 2. Save the JWT-Token you received in the variable `refresh_token` 3. Request new access token with `POST:/user/auth/token/access` 4. Save access token to variable `access_token` An access token is automatically generated using a default `client_id` and `secret`. PayPal recommends using your own `client_id` and `secret` from the [Developer Dashboard](https://www.paypal.com/signin?intent=developer&returnUri=https%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.paypal.com%2Fdeveloper%2Fapplication) by entering the values under the **Variables** tab. A pre-request script will generate and manage the `access_token` automatically. > **Note:** Your developer account `client_id` and `secret` may have a different scope than the default `client_id` and `secret`. ## Step 3: Make your first API call Embloy recommends starting with the Jobs and Quicklink APIs. These steps will use the Jobs and Quicklink APIs to create a job and capture applications using [sandbox accounts](https://developer.paypal.com/developer/accounts) linked to your Developer Dashboard account. To create an order: 1. In your workspace, navigate to your fork of the Embloy collection. 2. Select **Jobs > Create Job**. 3. Select the **Send** button to create the job. On a successful call, the API returns a `201 job created` response code. To upload an application: 1. In the response of the order you created, find the `id` of the job. 2. In the **Variables** tab, enter it into the `own_job_id` field. 3. Select **Quicklink > Send application**. 4. Select **Send**. On a successful call, the API returns a `201 application submitted response` code. Your job has been created and an application has been captured. You can verify the transaction in both the sandbox personal account and the sandbox business account.

item.name: Authentication

request.description: This makes sure that the Embloy account was registerd successfully and automatically claims the initial refresh token. Verifying an account is mandatory before using any function of Embloy's plattform.

This first authenticates the account credentials and then issues a refresh token for this specific verified Embloy account. Refresh tokens only possess a time-limited validity. (current default validity is 2 weeks) Refresh tokens are primarily used to claim the much more powerful (but much shorter valid) access tokens.

header.description: A valid refresh token is needed in order to be able to create an access_token.

request.description: This first verifies the provided refresh token and then issues an access token for the specific account associated with the refresh token. Access tokens only possess a very short time-limited validity or 20 minutes currently. Access tokens are a very important aspect of dealing with the Embloy API. Nearly every endpoint requires the provision of a valid access token. In conclusion access tokens are quite powerfull, have a short validity interval and can be claimend with a valid refresh token. Refresh tokens are less powerfull than access tokens but they possess a longer validity intervall and are mainly used for claiming access tokens.

item.description: All request regarding user authentication and access token creation.

item.name: Jobs

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then a user specific job feed is generated and returned.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

query.description: Returns jobs with titles, positions and descriptions matching your query
Filter by a job category of your choice

request.description: Search all jobs on embloy. Optionally filtered by `query`, `job_type` and `sort_by`.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

query.description: The longitute of the desired position.
The latitude of the desired position.

request.description: Returns job map (= jobs near the user's position: `longitude`, `latitude`)

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then the job is returned. (Only if the the user is authorized to access the resource and if the resource exists)

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

formdata.description: The timestamp of when the job starts
Key skills relevant for this job
A brief description (<500characters) of the job
Cover image of your job posting
formdata.fileNotInWorkingDirectoryWarning: This file isn't in your working directory. Teammates you share this request with won't be able to use this file. To make collaboration easier you can setup your working directory in Settings.

query.description: The id of the job you want to update

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then an existing job is updated.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

formdata.description: The timestamp of when the job starts
Key skills relevant for this job
A brief description (<500characters) of the job
Cover image of your job posting
Allowed cv_formats for the job's applications
Cover image of your job posting
formdata.fileNotInWorkingDirectoryWarning: This file isn't in your working directory. Teammates you share this request with won't be able to use this file. To make collaboration easier you can setup your working directory in Settings.

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then a new job is created. Upon creation, a job is listed as public. Public jobs undergo evaluation by Embloy's Job Ranking Engine and may appear in a user's individual job feed. Moreover, such jobs are open to applications from interested candidates. The job creator/owner or correspondingly authorized users correspondingly authorized users are able to limit the visibility of the job to "private". Private jobs are ignored by the Job Ranking Engine and so do not appear to any job seeking user.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: Please note that this method is not part of the standard usage and requires editor-level or above user permissions. Use with caution. The provided access token is first verified, and then a given job is irreversibly deleted from the system. To only remove a job post you can either use the PATCH /jobs method and change the job_status to 0.

item.description:
All requests related to job finding & handling.

#### Note #1:

`POST:/user/image`, `POST:/jobs` and `POST:/jobs/{job_id}/applications` require you to insert a local file to be submitted.

#### Note #2:

`POST:/jobs` needs a valid `start_slot` date to be created. To do so, you need to make sure that the date lies in the future and is not more than one year in advance.

item.name: User

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: This creates an user at its related records. In its entirety, this is referred to as an Embloy account. A freshly created Embloy account is inactive and first needs to be verified by the user.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then a list of all the jobs associated with its owner is generated.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then a list of all the job for which the current user has applied for an then has been accepted is generated.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then a list of all the job applications associated with its owner is generated.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then a response containing user preferences associated with its owner is generated.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then a list of all reviews associated with its owner is generated.The reviews cover both employer and employee submissions, providing a comprehensive overview of the experiences and perspectives.

This creates an user at its related records. In its entirety, this is referred to as an Embloy account. An freshly created Embloy account is inactive and first needs to be verified by the user. Note that the minimum password length is 8 characters and the maximum password length is 72 characters. `password` and `password_confirmation` need to match.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

formdata.description: The user's new profile image as a file
formdata.fileNotInWorkingDirectoryWarning: This file isn't in your working directory. Teammates you share this request with won't be able to use this file. To make collaboration easier you can setup your working directory in Settings.

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then the user's profile image is updated.

query.description: Email of the account that needs to reset password.

request.description: Initiates the password reset process by sending an email with a password reset token (valid for 15 minutes) to the current user's email.

query.description: Password reset token provided which can also be found in the email sent to the user when he initiates the password reset process

request.description: Resets the current user's password. Note that the minimum password length is 8 characters and the maximum password length is 72 characters. `password` and `password_confirmation` need to match.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: Updates the current user's password. Note that the minimum password length is 8 characters and the maximum password length is 72 characters. `password` and `password_confirmation` need to match.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then the current user's profile is updated.

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then the current user as well as all other associated records are deleted permanently.

item.description: All requests related to user's own jobs, applications, profile, preferences and reviews.

item.name: [TODO] Applications
Get all applications for a job

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then all received applications for the given jobs are returned.

item.name: Get user's submitted application for a job

request.description: The provided access token is first verified, and then a new application in the name of the associated user is submitted to the specified job. For Embloy v0 the user account (in detail the user profile) is considered to be the figurehead with which one applies for a job.

item.description: All requests for creating and reacting to applications using core-server v1.

item.name: Quicklink

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the current user. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

query.description: Custom expiration (will be set to the end of client's subscription, if it exceeds the subscription's expiration date)

request.description:
If the user has the necessary role, a **`client_token`** is generated based on  
the decoded subject (sub) of the token. The generated **`client_token`** is  
then returned in the response (valid for 3months).

header.description: A valid client_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the client. For further information see: [client_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#86b2cf1c-b02e-4d83-b65f-9c5e03cc89c4)

request.description: This endpoint is responsible for creating a **`request_token`**. for a specific job and client with a validity of 30 minutes. It uses the decoded **`client_token`**'s subject (sub) and a specific identifier ("job#1") to generate the token. The generated request token is then returned in the response which can be used as authentication for further requests to the core-API.

header.description: A valid request_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the client. For further information see: [request_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#cb4b3c33-f0b8-4f76-af72-f8b325e16bb8)

A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the applicant. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description:
Handles the _Quicklink_ application process. It finds the user based on the decoded  
user's **`access_token`** token's subject (sub) and the client based on the  
decoded **`request_token`**'s subject (sub). The method then  
updates or creates the job based on the decoded **`request_token`**'s job  
information and applies for the job.
> _**NOTE**_: This request is only used for testing with different user credentials

header.description: A valid access_token is needed to authenticate and authorize the applicant. For further information see: [access_token endpoint](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/24977803/2s9YRB2rkE#e29e5a54-533b-413a-9e04-b608cc4acd68)

request.description: > _**NOTE**_: This request is only used for testing with different user credentials

Add the payment method via the API and mark it as the default for future payments

request.description:
Creates a checkout session for either a recurring 'subscription' or a one-time 'payment'.

Returns customer and payment information including stripe url (e.g., "[https://checkout.stripe.com/c/pay/..."](https://checkout.stripe.com/c/pay/...))
